1 #ifndef VOXBLOX_MESH_MESH_UTILS_H_
2 #define VOXBLOX_MESH_MESH_UTILS_H_
3 
4 #include <vector>
5 
6 #include "voxblox/core/block_hash.h"
7 #include "voxblox/core/common.h"
8 #include "voxblox/mesh/mesh.h"
9 
10 namespace voxblox {
11 
12 // Combines all given meshes into a single mesh with connected verticies. Also
13 // removes triangles with zero surface area. If you only would like to connect
14 // vertices, make sure that the proximity threhsold <<< voxel size. If you would
15 // like to simplify the mesh, chose a threshold greater or near the voxel size
16 // until you reached the level of simpliciation desired.
17 inline void createConnectedMesh(
18  const AlignedVector<Mesh::ConstPtr>& meshes, Mesh* connected_mesh,
19  const FloatingPoint approximate_vertex_proximity_threshold = 1e-10) {
20  CHECK_NOTNULL(connected_mesh);
21 
22  // Used to prevent double ups in vertices. We need to use a long long based
23  // index, to prevent overflows.
24  LongIndexHashMapType<size_t>::type uniques;
25 
26  const double threshold_inv =
27  1. / static_cast<double>(approximate_vertex_proximity_threshold);
28 
29  // Combine everything in the layer into one giant combined mesh.
30  size_t new_vertex_index = 0u;
31  for (const Mesh::ConstPtr& mesh : meshes) {
32  // Skip empty meshes.
33  if (mesh->vertices.empty()) {
34  continue;
35  }
36 
37  // Make sure there are 3 distinct vertices for every triangle before
38  // merging.
39  CHECK_EQ(mesh->vertices.size(), mesh->indices.size());
40  CHECK_EQ(mesh->vertices.size() % 3u, 0u);
41  CHECK_EQ(mesh->indices.size() % 3u, 0u);
42 
43  // Stores the mapping from old vertex index to the new one in the combined
44  // mesh. This is later used to adapt the triangles to the new, global
45  // indexing of the combined mesh.
46  std::vector<size_t> old_to_new_indices;
47  old_to_new_indices.resize(mesh->vertices.size());
48 
49  size_t new_num_vertices_from_this_block = 0u;
50  for (size_t old_vertex_idx = 0u; old_vertex_idx < mesh->vertices.size();
51  ++old_vertex_idx) {
52  // We scale the vertices by the inverse of the merging tolerance and
53  // then compute a discretized grid index in that scale.
54  // This exhibits the behaviour of merging two vertices that are
55  // closer than the threshold.
56  CHECK_LT(old_vertex_idx, mesh->vertices.size());
57  const Point vertex = mesh->vertices[old_vertex_idx];
58  const Eigen::Vector3d scaled_vector =
59  vertex.cast<double>() * threshold_inv;
60  const LongIndex vertex_3D_index = LongIndex(
61  std::round(scaled_vector.x()), std::round(scaled_vector.y()),
62  std::round(scaled_vector.z()));
63 
64  // If the current vertex falls into the same grid cell as a previous
65  // vertex, we merge them. This is done by assigning the new vertex to
66  // the same vertex index as the first vertex that fell into that cell.
67 
68  LongIndexHashMapType<size_t>::type::const_iterator it =
69  uniques.find(vertex_3D_index);
70 
71  const bool vertex_is_unique_so_far = (it == uniques.end());
72  if (vertex_is_unique_so_far) {
73  // Copy vertex and associated data to combined mesh.
74  connected_mesh->vertices.push_back(vertex);
75 
76  if (mesh->hasColors()) {
77  CHECK_LT(old_vertex_idx, mesh->colors.size());
78  connected_mesh->colors.push_back(mesh->colors[old_vertex_idx]);
79  }
80  if (mesh->hasNormals()) {
81  CHECK_LT(old_vertex_idx, mesh->normals.size());
82  connected_mesh->normals.push_back(mesh->normals[old_vertex_idx]);
83  }
84 
85  // Store the new vertex index in the unique-vertex-map to be able to
86  // retrieve this index later if we encounter vertices that are
87  // supposed to be merged with this one.
88  CHECK(uniques.emplace(vertex_3D_index, new_vertex_index).second);
89 
90  // Also store a mapping from old index to new index for this mesh
91  // block to later adapt the triangle indexing.
92  CHECK_LT(old_vertex_idx, old_to_new_indices.size());
93  old_to_new_indices[old_vertex_idx] = new_vertex_index;
94 
95  ++new_vertex_index;
96  ++new_num_vertices_from_this_block;
97  } else {
98  // If this vertex is not unique, we map it's vertex index to the new
99  // vertex index.
100  CHECK_LT(old_vertex_idx, old_to_new_indices.size());
101  old_to_new_indices[old_vertex_idx] = it->second;
102 
103  // Add all normals (this will average them once they are renormalized
104  // later)
105  connected_mesh->normals[it->second] += mesh->normals[old_vertex_idx];
106  }
107 
108  // Make sure the indexing is correct.
109  CHECK_EQ(connected_mesh->vertices.size(), new_vertex_index);
110  }
111 
112  // Renormalize normals
113  for (Point& normal : connected_mesh->normals) {
114  FloatingPoint length = normal.norm();
115  if (length > kEpsilon) {
116  normal /= length;
117  } else {
118  normal = Point(0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
119  }
120  }
121 
122  // Make sure we have a mapping for every old vertex index.
123  CHECK_EQ(old_to_new_indices.size(), mesh->vertices.size());
124 
125  // Append triangles and adjust their indices if necessary.
126  // We discard triangles where all old vertices were mapped to the same
127  // vertex.
128  size_t new_num_triangle_from_this_block = 0u;
129  for (size_t triangle_idx = 0u; triangle_idx < mesh->indices.size();
130  triangle_idx += 3u) {
131  CHECK_LT(triangle_idx + 2u, mesh->indices.size());
132 
133  // Retrieve old vertex indices.
134  size_t vertex_0 = mesh->indices[triangle_idx];
135  size_t vertex_1 = mesh->indices[triangle_idx + 1u];
136  size_t vertex_2 = mesh->indices[triangle_idx + 2u];
137 
138  // Make sure the old indices were valid before remapping.
139  CHECK_LT(vertex_0, old_to_new_indices.size());
140  CHECK_LT(vertex_1, old_to_new_indices.size());
141  CHECK_LT(vertex_2, old_to_new_indices.size());
142 
143  // Apply vertex index mapping.
144  vertex_0 = old_to_new_indices[vertex_0];
145  vertex_1 = old_to_new_indices[vertex_1];
146  vertex_2 = old_to_new_indices[vertex_2];
147 
148  // Make sure the new indices are valid after remapping.
149  CHECK_LT(vertex_0, new_vertex_index);
150  CHECK_LT(vertex_1, new_vertex_index);
151  CHECK_LT(vertex_2, new_vertex_index);
152 
153  // Get rid of triangles where all two or three vertices have been
154  // merged.
155  const bool two_or_three_vertex_indices_are_the_same =
156  (vertex_0 == vertex_1) || (vertex_1 == vertex_2) ||
157  (vertex_0 == vertex_2);
158 
159  if (!two_or_three_vertex_indices_are_the_same) {
160  connected_mesh->indices.push_back(vertex_0);
161  connected_mesh->indices.push_back(vertex_1);
162  connected_mesh->indices.push_back(vertex_2);
163  ++new_num_triangle_from_this_block;
164  }
165  }
166  }
167 
168  // Verify combined mesh.
169  if (connected_mesh->hasColors()) {
170  CHECK_EQ(connected_mesh->vertices.size(), connected_mesh->colors.size());
171  }
172  if (connected_mesh->hasNormals()) {
173  CHECK_EQ(connected_mesh->vertices.size(), connected_mesh->normals.size());
174  }
175 }
176 
177 inline void createConnectedMesh(
178  const Mesh& mesh, Mesh* connected_mesh,
179  const FloatingPoint approximate_vertex_proximity_threshold = 1e-10) {
180  AlignedVector<Mesh::ConstPtr> meshes;
181  meshes.push_back(Mesh::ConstPtr(&mesh, [](Mesh const*) {}));
182  createConnectedMesh(meshes, connected_mesh,
183  approximate_vertex_proximity_threshold);
184 }
185
